text: Ludwig von Brenner (born Leipzig, 19 September 1833; died 9 February 1902) was a German conductor and composer. He studied at the Leipzig conservatory. He went to Saint Petersburg to play in the Saint Petersburg Philharmonic Orchestra. In 1872, he returned to Germany and conducted an orchestra called the Berlin Symphony Orchestra. He then started an orchestra called Neue Berliner Symphoniekapelle. In 1882, he became the first conductor of a new orchestra, the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra, which was soon to become one of the world's best orchestras. Category:1833 births Category:1902 deaths Category:19th-century German composers Category:German conductors
title: Ludwig von Brenner
